intro: Carex hornschuchiana var. laurentiana, commonly known as the Laurentian sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and form dense colonies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
